item.title: Flour Babies
item.description: Flour Babies Title: Flour Babies Author: Anne Fine Flour Babies is a delightful children’s book written by Anne Fine, which was first published in 1992. The story revolves around a group of elementary school students who are given flour sacks as their ‘babies’ to take care of, as part of a school project. The project aims to teach the students about the responsibilities and challenges of parenthood. The book is suitable for children between the ages of 8 and 12 years old.

item.title: The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole
item.description: The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole Title: The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole Author: Sue Townsend Genre: Children’s Fiction, Coming-of-age, Humor Recommended Age Group: 9-12 years old The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole is a heartwarming and humorous tale that follows the life of a 13-year-old boy named Adrian Mole. item.title: The October Child
item.description: The October Child by Eleanor Spence Title: The October Child Author: Eleanor Spence Review: The October Child is a beautifully written and illustrated children’s book that captures the essence of the changing seasons and the magic of childhood. The book is aimed at children between the ages of 4 and 8 years old.

item.title: Eric, or Little by Little
item.description: Eric, or Little Title: Eric, or Little Author: Sarah Grand Review: “Eric, or Little” is a delightful children’s book that follows the adventures of a young boy named Eric, who is trying to find his place in the world. The story is filled with valuable life lessons and is perfect for children aged 6-10 years old. The book is set in a small village, where Eric lives with his family. item.title: The Tale of Despereaux
item.description: The Tale of Despereaux by Kate DiCamillo Title: The Tale of Despereaux Author: Kate DiCamillo Review: The Tale of Despereaux is a charming and heartwarming children’s book written by Kate DiCamillo. The story follows the adventures of a small, brave, and big-hearted mouse named Despereaux. The book is a delightful blend of adventure, fantasy, and a touch of romance, making it a perfect read for young readers. The Tale of Despereaux targets the age group of 8 to 12 years old.

item.title: Three Fairy Tales
item.description: Three Fairy Tales by Gustavo Martin Garzo Title: Three Fairy Tales Author: Gustavo Martin Garzo Review: “Three Fairy Tales” by Gustavo Martin Garzo is a delightful collection of enchanting stories that captivate the imagination of young readers. item.title: Tom Brown's School Days
item.description: Tom Brown’s School Days by Thomas Hughes Title: Tom Brown’s School Days Author: Thomas Hughes Review: Tom Brown’s School Days is a classic children’s book written by Thomas Hughes, first published in 1857. The story follows the life of Tom Brown, a young boy who attends Rugby School, a boarding school in England. The book is set in the early 19th century and provides an insightful look into the life of a schoolboy during that time.

item.title: My Girragundji

The book is beautifully illustrated, and the text is simple and engaging, making it perfect for children aged 4 to 8 years old. The story explores themes of friendship, loss, and the importance of cherishing the memories we create with our loved ones.

item.title: Poordog the Starved

item.title: When the Wind Blows

item.title: Stradbroke Dreamtime
item.description: Stradbroke Dreamtime by Oodgeroo Noonucal Title: Stradbroke Dreamtime Author: Oodgeroo Noonucal Review: Stradbroke Dreamtime is a beautifully written and illustrated children’s book that takes readers on a captivating journey through the rich cultural heritage of the Aboriginal people of Australia. item.title: Nurse Matilda
item.description: Nurse Matilda by Christianna Brand Title: Nurse Matilda Author: Christianna Brand Review: Nurse Matilda is a delightful children’s book written by Christianna Brand, which tells the story of a family of children who are quite unruly and misbehaving. The parents, Mr. and Mrs. Brown, are at their wit’s end trying to manage their children’s behavior. That’s when they decide to hire a nanny, Nurse Matilda, who seems to possess some magical powers that help the children learn important life lessons.

item.title: Stig of the Dump

item.title: Rabbit Hill by Robert Lawson

item.title: The Story of Doctor Dolittle

item.title: The Boy Who Grew Flowers
